* This source file was generated by the Gradle 'init' task
Bro task manager is a simple and intuitive task management application that helps you track todos, deadlines, adn events. It keeps you organized with your schedule with ease of use and flexibility.
This allow users to add tasks with a due date. This ensures that you can track time-sensitive tasks and be notified.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 6 tasks in the list.
A **ToDo** is a task without any date or time attached to it.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
An **Event** is a task that has a start and end time, making it ideal for tracking appointments or multi-day events.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 6 tasks in the list.
You can list all your tasks, including ToDos, Deadlines, and Events, to get an overview of what you need to do.
Here are the tasks in your list:
This feature allows users to delete tasks from the list, whether they are ToDos, Deadlines, or Events.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.

The task list is automatically saved to the hard disk whenever there is a change in the list, and it is loaded when the chatbot starts up. The tasks are saved in a file, and the format of the saved file includes the task type, completion status, and task details.
The file can be saved as ./data/duke.txt in this format:
This feature allows users to search for tasks by a keyword, whether the task is a ToDo, Deadline, or Event.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Simply type "Bye" to exit the program.

* Entry point for the Bro Task Manager application.
* Initializes the UI, loads tasks from storage, and processes user commands.
* Builder class for a deadline object.

* @return the save format of the deadline task.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from The start date of the event in string format.
* @param to The end date of the event in string format.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Return the string format for the current event.
* @return the string format of the event task.
return "[E]" + currentStatus() + " " + description + " (from: " + displayFrom + " to: " + displayTo + ")";
* Return the to be saved format for the current event.
* @return the save format of the event task.
* Initializes the parser with a list of tasks.

System.out.println("Bye! Hope to see you again.");
System.out.println("No tasks yet! Please add tasks.");
* @param command user input to be executed.
System.out.println("Description of a todo cannot be empty. Please provide a task description.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task\n " + todo);
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Add a task with a deadline.
* @param command user input to be executed.
System.out.println("Description of a deadline cannot be empty. Please provide a task description and due date.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task\n " + deadline);
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Add an event with a from and to.
* @param command user input to be executed.
System.out.println("Description of an event cannot be empty. Please provide a task description, from, and end date.");
Event event = new Event(infos[0], infos[1], infos[2]);
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task\n " + event);
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Delete a task from the current storage.
* @param command user input to be executed.
System.out.println("Please provide the task index to delete.");
System.out.println("I've removed this task for you: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");

* Manages the user interface, including showing welcome messages, menus, and reading user input.
private final Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);
* Reads a command input from the user.
* Display the welcome message and menu to the user.
System.out.println("\nWelcome to the Task Manager! Here are your available commands:");
System.out.println("2. todo <description> - Add a Todo task");
System.out.println("3. deadline <description> /by <date> - Add a Deadline task");
System.out.println("4. event <description> /from <start> /to <end> - Add an Event task");
System.out.println("5. delete <task number> - Delete a task by its number");
System.out.println("6. mark <task number> - Mark a task as done");
System.out.println("7. unmark <task number> - Mark a task as not done");
System.out.println("8. find <keyword> - Search tasks by keyword");
